intro: Neolloydia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered neolloydia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant produces showy white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a subtle, spicy scent, typical of the carrot family. Neolloydia grandiflora is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
